responses: 0: Through the threat of or application of force, such as a coup or rebellion.
2: Appointed by the ruling party (in a one-party system).
6: Appointed by the head of state.
8: Directly through a popular election (regardless of the extension of the suffrage).
citation: V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
notes: Converted from (B) to (A) coding. v2expathhg is coded according to appointment dates of the Head of Government. The same is true for coups or rebellions where the date when the HOG was appointed through a coup, or the first day in office after the coup, is coded.
question: How did the head of government gain access to office?
name: v2expathhg
